headline: Chevron-chartered tanker docks at Venezuela to load oil after new US license
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -A Chevron-chartered tanker docked at Venezuelan state company PDVSA's Jose terminal on Tuesday, positioning it to be the first to export crude to the United States under a new license Chevron received in July, LSEG tracking data showed.  The U.S. Treasury Department late last month authorized Chevron to operate in the sanctioned OPEC nation again, export its oil and do swaps with PDVSA through a restricted license banning any payments to Venezuela's government.  Chevron suspended loading of Venezuelan crude in April ahead of its prior license's expiration on May 27.

The U.S. Treasury Department late last month authorized Chevron to operate in the sanctioned OPEC nation again, export its oil and do swaps with PDVSA through a restricted license banning any payments to Venezuela's government.  Chevron suspended loading of Venezuelan crude in April ahead of its prior license's expiration on May 27.

headline: Big Oil Boosts Exploration as Energy Transition Sputters
summary: After years of pledging to cut fossil fuel output, Big Oil is pivoting back to large-scale oil and gas exploration as the energy transition slows and conventional energy profits remain strong.

raw.headline: Big Oil Boosts Exploration as Energy Transition Sputters

headline: Energy Transition Today - Genie Energy Navigates Challenges In Renewable Energy Growth
summary: Genie Energy Ltd. reported mixed results for the second quarter of 2025, reflecting the complexities of the current energy transition landscape. Despite achieving double-digit revenue growth, the company experienced margin compression due to increased wholesale power prices and higher consumption driven by unseasonably hot weather. Growth in renewable initiatives was highlighted by ongoing solar projects, although certain developments were paused following federal policy changes affecting...
